course.title: Advanced Topics in British Empiricism
course.faculty_text: Alison Simmons and Jeffrey K. McDonough
course.description: The so-called British Empiricists (Locke, Berkeley, and Hume) take us on a journey from very sensible philosophical starting points to rather extravagant sounding philosophical conclusions. In this course we will look in depth at specific interpretive and philosophical issues that arise in connection with the British Empiricist tradition. Familiarity with the central works of Locke, Berkeley and Hume - such as one might acquire in Phil 122 or a similar course - will be presupposed.
